title: Uspanteco (2010) New Testament
description: The Uspanteko (Uspanteco, Uspanteko, Uspantec) is the Mayan language of Guatemala, closely related to Kʼicheʼ. It is spoken in the Uspantán and Playa Grande Ixcán municipios, in the Department El Quiché. It is also one of only three Mayan languages to have developed contrastive tone (the others being Yukatek and one dialect of Tzotzil). It distinguishes between vowels with a high tone and vowels with a low tone.

language.name: Uspanteco
language.area: Quiché Department, San Miguel Uspantán. The center is Las Pacayas village.
